intro: Dicliptera cyclostegia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slightly hairy texture. Dicliptera cyclostegia is typically found in grasslands and open savannas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
